string

disarm_gears.r_plugins.r_methods.mgcv_fit(formula, data, family='gaussian', weights=None, method='REML', bam=False, chunk_size=1000)¶

Fit a Generalized Additive Model

This function is a wrapper of the MGCV package in R. See its definition for more details https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/mgcv/versions/1.8-28/topics/gam

Parameters

  • formula – R formula string

  • data – Data to fit the model to pandas DataFrame

  • family – Noise model distribution string. One of ‘gaussian’, ‘binomial’, ‘poisson’ (default ‘gaussian’).

  • weights – Observation weights numpy ndarray

  • method – Smoothing parameter estimation method (see R MGCV documentation) string, one of ‘GCV.Cp’, ‘GACV.Cp’, ‘REML’, ‘P-REML’, ‘ML’, ‘fREML’ (default ‘REML’).

  • bam – If MGCV implementation for large datasets should be used Boolean

  • chunk_size – Size of chunks in which the model matrix is created (Only used when bam=True). Integer

Returns

robjects.vectors.ListVector

disarm_gears.r_plugins.r_methods.mgcv_get_rho_power_exp2(iter_formula, data, smooth_dim, family='gaussian', weights=None, method='REML')¶

For a GAM model with gp smooth of type exponentiated quadratic find the best lengthscale (rho) parameter

Parameters

  • iter_formula – R formula String

  • data – Data to fit the model to pandas DataFrame

  • smooth_dim – Dimensionality of the smooth interpolation. The only values accepted are 1 and 2. Integer

  • family – Noise model distribution (see mgcv_fit) String

  • weights – Observation weights (see mgcv_fit) Numpy ndarray

  • method – Smoothing parameter estimation method (see mgcv_fit). String, defaults to ‘REML’.

Returns

float

disarm_gears.r_plugins.r_methods.mgcv_posterior_samples(gam, data, n_samples=100, response_type='inverse_link') → numpy.ndarray¶

Generate samples from the posterior distribution of a GAM

See R MGCV package

Parameters

  • gam – A gam model previously fitted robjects.vectors.ListVector

  • data – Input data points where simulations are generated Pandas DataFrame

  • n_samples – Number of samples to generate Integer (default 100)

  • response_type – Space or transformation in which the prediction is returned (see R MGCV documentation) String. One of ‘response’, ‘link’, ‘inverse_link’, ‘lpmatrix’.

Returns

numpy ndarray of shape (n_samples, n_data)

disarm_gears.r_plugins.r_methods.mgcv_predict(gam, data, response_type='response')¶

Make predictions using a fitted GAM model

See R MGCV package

Parameters

  • gam – A gam model previously fitted robjects.vectors.ListVector

  • data – Input data points where predictions are made pandas DataFrame

  • response_type – Space or transformation in which the prediction is returned (see R MGCV documentation) string. One of ‘response’, ‘link’, ‘lpmatrix’.

Returns

numpy ndarray of shape (n_data, ) with the posterior mean values.

Converts a pandas DataFrame into an R dataframe

data – Data to convert into an R dataframe pandas DataFrame
